subject: Re: Test Dependencies
msgSnippet: I would create several tests from simple to more complex: 1) testLoadLicense, which will load from test file. 2) testSaveLicense, which will save known license
messageBody:
I would create several tests from simple to more complex:
1) testLoadLicense, which will load from test file.
2) testSaveLicense, which will save known license to a file and
assert on file compare
3) testSaveAndLoadLicense, which will perform both operations

Mockup files as a string streams can be useful. Once you got your
tests you can try coverage reporting tool. See
http://hansel.sourceforge.net/ for example


--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Bryce Fischer" <bryce@b...> wrote:
> Given that I have two methods of my class I need to test,
SaveLicense and
> LoadLicense, should I write this as two separate tests or as a
single test
> that incorporates both? To clarify, to load a license, I would need
to have
> a saved license. The load license would then verify that the
information
> that was saved was loaded correctly.
